instruction: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, salt, and lemon juice.
title: Prepare Marinade

transcript_segments.text: As-salamu alaykum. Today I'm sharing with you the recipe to make Sindhi Biryani. It's quite different from regular biryani — much spicier and more flavorful by comparison.
To make Sindhi Biryani, we first need to prepare the biryani masala powder. Take 1 tbsp coriander seeds, 1 tsp white cumin, ½ tsp black cumin (shahi jeera), and 1 tsp...
...¼ piece of nutmeg, 1 black cardamom, 2 small cinnamon sticks, 12–13 green cardamoms, 1 star anise, and 5–6...
I’ve ground all the whole spices into a powder. Now add 1 tsp Kashmiri red chili powder (you can use regular chili but it'll be spicier), 2 tsp or to taste...
Sindhi biryani uses dried plums (aloo bukhara), so try to add them. If you don’t have them, you can substitute with a bay leaf. Mix everything well, and your masala is ready.
For the biryani, I’ve taken 1 kg chicken. I’ll be using equal parts rice and chicken — so 1 kg rice as well. Now add 3 tablespoons...
Add ginger-garlic paste and the masala we just made. This is a great homemade spice blend — no need for store-bought masala.
Add green chilies to taste — I’m adding 2–3. Also add chopped coriander, mint, and 2 medium-sized tomatoes (about ½ cup).

instruction: Add the mutton or chicken pieces to the marinade. Mix well and let it rest for at least 1-2 hours in the refrigerator.
title: Marinate the Meat

transcript_segments.text: Mix all ingredients well. If you have time, marinate for longer. If not, just 20–25 minutes is enough — don’t over-marinate.
For layering, I’ve sliced 3 medium tomatoes. Altogether, I’ve used 300g tomatoes in this recipe.

instruction: Peel and cut potatoes in halves. Rinse and pat them dry.
title: Prepare Potatoes

transcript_segments.text: I’ve also taken 3 medium-sized potatoes, cut into large chunks, and soaked them in orange food color for 30 mins. This is optional.

instruction: Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the potato halves until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
title: Fry Potatoes

transcript_segments.text: I’ve also taken 3 medium-sized potatoes, cut into large chunks, and soaked them in orange food color for 30 mins. This is optional.

instruction: In a large pot, heat oil. Add cumin seeds, black peppercorns, cloves, cardamoms, cinnamon, and bay leaf. Fry for 30-40 seconds until fragrant.
title: Heat Oil and Fry Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: I’ve soaked the rice for 1 hour. Use any good quality basmati rice that you usually prefer for biryani.
Let’s start making the biryani. Take a pan and add ½ cup oil. Total we’ll use 1 cup oil (approx. 250ml). We’ll use the other half later during layering.

instruction: Add sliced onions to the pot. Fry them on medium heat until deep golden brown, stirring occasionally.
title: Add and Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: We’ll use one onion later for layering. Now add the marinated chicken to the pan. No need to add any extra spices — everything is already in it. Cook on high flame.

instruction: Add chopped tomatoes to the browned onions. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the mixture thickens.
title: Cook Tomatoes

transcript_segments.text: We’ll use one onion later for layering. Now add the marinated chicken to the pan. No need to add any extra spices — everything is already in it. Cook on high flame.

instruction: Add the marinated meat along with all the marinade to the pot. Stir well to combine with the onion-tomato base.
title: Add Marinated Meat

transcript_segments.text: We’ll use one onion later for layering. Now add the marinated chicken to the pan. No need to add any extra spices — everything is already in it. Cook on high flame.
We want to cook the chicken, so now add the potatoes as well, and ½ cup water. Mix well and cover to cook for about 20 minutes.

instruction: Cover and cook the meat on medium heat until tender and oil separates from the masala. Add water as needed during cooking.
title: Cook Meat Until Tender

transcript_segments.text: We want to cook the chicken, so now add the potatoes as well, and ½ cup water. Mix well and cover to cook for about 20 minutes.
I cooked the chicken for 20–25 minutes on low flame. It's fully done. Now turn the flame to high and dry up any extra water completely.

instruction: Mix in coriander powder and garam masala powder. Cook for a few more minutes to deepen the flavor.
title: Add Powdered Spices

transcript_segments.text: Take 4 times the rice quantity of water. Add 3 tbsp salt and 2 tbsp oil. This keeps the rice from sticking. Also add lemon slices for flavor.

instruction: Add the fried potatoes, chopped mint leaves, coriander leaves, and slit green chilies. Stir gently to blend.
title: Add Fried Potatoes and Herbs

transcript_segments.text: Take 4 times the rice quantity of water. Add 3 tbsp salt and 2 tbsp oil. This keeps the rice from sticking. Also add lemon slices for flavor.

instruction: Rinse the basmati rice in water 2-3 times. Soak in water for 30 minutes, then drain.
title: Rinse and Soak Rice

transcript_segments.text: Take 4 times the rice quantity of water. Add 3 tbsp salt and 2 tbsp oil. This keeps the rice from sticking. Also add lemon slices for flavor.

instruction: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add salt generously.
title: Boil Water for Rice

transcript_segments.text: Take 4 times the rice quantity of water. Add 3 tbsp salt and 2 tbsp oil. This keeps the rice from sticking. Also add lemon slices for flavor.

instruction: Add soaked rice to boiling water. Cook until 70-80% done. Drain and keep aside.
title: Cook Rice Partially

transcript_segments.text: Once the water boils, add the soaked rice. Since it’s soaked well, it will cook quickly. Cook on high flame till the rice is about 70% done.

instruction: In a large heavy-bottomed pot, spread half of the cooked rice at the bottom.
title: Start Layering

transcript_segments.text: Now prepare for layering. First apply oil at the bottom of the pot. This prevents sticking or burning. Add one layer of rice, then...

instruction: Spread the cooked meat masala with potatoes evenly over the rice layer.
title: Add Meat Mixture

transcript_segments.text: ...add the next layer of chicken masala and some rice. Save a bit of rice for the top layer. Now sprinkle coriander and mint.

instruction: Add the remaining rice on top. Gently level it out.
title: Top Final Rice Layer

transcript_segments.text: ...add the next layer of chicken masala and some rice. Save a bit of rice for the top layer. Now sprinkle coriander and mint.

instruction: Drizzle saffron milk on top. Sprinkle remaining mint, coriander, and some reserved fried onions if available.
title: Add Final Garnish

transcript_segments.text: ...add the next layer of chicken masala and some rice. Save a bit of rice for the top layer. Now sprinkle coriander and mint.
Pour the remaining gravy on top. Add the last layer of rice, followed by tomato, mint, coriander, ginger, green chilies, and fried onions.
Now pour the remaining oil on top — this is the same oil we used to fry the onions. I’ve used 1 cup total oil. Don’t worry if it feels like too much — biryani needs it.

instruction: Seal the pot with a tight-fitting lid or dough. Place on low heat and cook for 20-25 minutes for dum (steam) cooking.
title: Seal and Dum Cook

transcript_segments.text: Now seal the pot — I’m using foil. You can also use a towel. Cook on high for 2 minutes, then place a heavy griddle (tawa) or plate below for dum.

instruction: Let the biryani rest for 10 minutes after cooking. Gently fluff and mix before serving with raita or salad.
title: Rest and Serve

transcript_segments.text: Once there’s good steam, that means your biryani is cooked through. Now gently mix from bottom to top.
Mix gently so that the rice doesn't break and the masala gets distributed evenly. The biryani is now ready to serve.
So this is how our Sindhi Biryani is made. I wish you could smell how aromatic it is! It’s super tasty and very easy to make — not complicated at all.
